result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Lee Troupe

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Witness List.  (Anthony L. Troupe - #2022010044, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Per Right of Speedy Trial.  (Anthony L. Troupe - #2022010044, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Anthony Lee Troupe appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defendant appears pro se.  Mr. Troupe enters a demand for speedy trial.  Speedy trial EXPIRES on January 17, 2023.  Court addresses Justice Point discharge.  Mr. Troupe informs the court that no discovery has been received.  State will resend discovery.  Court scheduled status conference and jury trial dates.  Court will address potential standby counsel at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Request for Motion Hearing.  (Anthony L. Troupe - #2022010044, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion for Dismissal.  (Anthony L. Troupe - #2022010044, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery.  (Anthony L. Troupe - #2022010044, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Witness List.  (Anthony L. Troupe - #2022010044, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Demand for Trial/Dismissal.  (Anthony L. Troupe - #2022010044, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Notice of Enslavement.  (Anthony L. Troupe - #2022010044, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion in Limine.  (Anthony L. Troupe - #2022010044, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Evidentiary Hearing Demand.  (Anthony L. Troupe - #2022010044, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Anthony Lee Troupe not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court waived defendants appearance for todays hearing. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk
Defendant's pro se Habeas Corpus

Defendant Anthony Lee Troupe in court in person, PRO-SE.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer N. Wiste. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RMS, UWM Campus

Turnover to Justice Point for level 3 supervision.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.

Defendant Anthony Lee Troupe in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears in court pro se.   Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.  Upon questioning, the Court finds the defendant competent to proceed and knowingly and voluntarily waives right to counsel.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Lee Troupe in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appear friend of the court.  Defendant Anthony Lee Troupe in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant request to appear Pro Se. Court advise defendant case set for HEARING in trial court to assess if defendant is compentant to proceed Pro Se.  Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Pro Se Motion for Dismissal,Petition for Waiver of Fees, Pro Se Motion for Speedy Trial and Pro Se Demand for Discovery received and filed.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/15/22 @ 1:30p
